MajorClaims.MC1: I prefer to learn with a teacher rather than learn by myself
MajorClaims.MC2: I support this point that the learning with a teacher is better

Claims.C1: being without a teacher has shortcomings
Claims.C2: learning with a teacher is that you can ask about problems related your studies
Claims.C3: the learning with a teacher is more efficient than by myself

Premises.P1: if someone faced so complicated confusion in his study and his many endeavors on making out it were miscarried, this might be ended in disappointment
Premises.P2: for one who depends on only himself in learning, his improvement of ability, with regard to cooperation and express his opinion, is unpromising
Premises.P3: when we encounter difficulty in our study which we can not make out, that asking the difficulty from our teacher is propitious way for us to solve it instantly
Premises.P4: professors and teachers have much experience and knowledge, and are so dextrous with letting students understand their study
Premises.P5: They know something which are not incorporated in such materials as books and webpages
Premises.P6: I, in my class, often communicate with my teacher to find a coordinated answer to a my faced problem, and my classmates are so accustomed to communicating with the teacher
Premises.P7: We can accomplish our assignments with little help of a teacher within less time than do it by ourself
Premises.P8: the teachers play important role in leading us to right direction
Premises.P9: This gives us opportunity to rise our educational level to an exited degree
Premises.P10: knowledge may be thereby better improved and strengthened
